attributes.action: Room to Care - for the elderly
attributes.additional_details:
'Room to Spare' is well advertised for placing children in need into foster homes.  Fully funded giving the children caring homes and foster carers an income and a respected job.
I would ask the government to please debate 'Room to Care' - to assist the elderly in need to be cared for in relatives homes / other private homes in their communities.  Could funding (as is appropriate) be provided for care in an ongoing home environment and the carers (to be registered/assessed) an income for a worthwhile job. The carers allowance as it is does not encourage care for the elderly. I would like to ask if the government will lead in raising the standard of 'Caring for the elderly' as a career choice and make it a respected role as is fostering children?
